quote.text: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.

I have seen many storms in my life. Most storms have caught me by surprise, so I had to learn very quickly to look further and understand that I am not capable of controlling the weather, to exercise the art of patience and to respect the fury of nature.
Patience is not simply the ability to wait - it's how we behave while we're waiting.
The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance.

I believe that a trusting attitude and a patient attitude go hand in hand. You see, when you let go and learn to trust God, it releases joy in your life. And when you trust God, you're able to be more patient. Patience is not just about waiting for something... it's about how you wait, or your attitude while waiting.
Have patience. All things are difficult before they become easy.

Never cut a tree down in the wintertime. Never make a negative decision in the low time. Never make your most important decisions when you are in your worst moods. Wait. Be patient. The storm will pass. The spring will come.
Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.

Sometimes we may ask God for success, and He gives us physical and mental stamina. We might plead for prosperity, and we receive enlarged perspective and increased patience, or we petition for growth and are blessed with the gift of grace. He may bestow upon us conviction and confidence as we strive to achieve worthy goals.
Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
Each life is made up of mistakes and learning, waiting and growing, practicing patience and being persistent.
Be patient and understanding. Life is too short to be vengeful or malicious.
Patience and perseverance have a magical effect before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish.
Alcohol gives you infinite patience for stupidity.
The test of good manners is to be patient with the bad ones.

Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word happy would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness. It is far better take things as they come along with patience and equanimity.

The creative people I admire seem to share many characteristics: A fierce restlessness. Healthy cynicism. A real world perspective. An ability to simplify. Restraint. Patience. A genuine balance of confidence and insecurity. And most importantly, humanity.
Patience is the companion of wisdom.
Hope is patience with the lamp lit.
Patience is a virtue, and I'm learning patience. It's a tough lesson.
I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
The key to everything is patience. You get the chicken by hatching the egg, not by smashing it.

Becoming a father increases your capacity for love and your level of patience. It opens up another door in a person - a door which you may not even have known was there. That's what I feel with my son. There's suddenly another level of love that expands. My son is my greatest joy, out of everything in my life.
With love and patience, nothing is impossible.

Qualities you need to get through medical school and residency: Discipline. Patience. Perseverance. A willingness to forgo sleep. A penchant for sadomasochism. Ability to weather crises of faith and self-confidence. Accept exhaustion as fact of life. Addiction to caffeine a definite plus. Unfailing optimism that the end is in sight.
Knowing trees, I understand the meaning of patience. Knowing grass, I can appreciate persistence.
We could never learn to be brave and patient, if there were only joy in the world.
Genius is patience.
I am patient with stupidity but not with those who are proud of it.
I am blessed to be surrounded by the people I love. I thank them for their patience and grace.
The keys to patience are acceptance and faith. Accept things as they are, and look realistically at the world around you. Have faith in yourself and in the direction you have chosen.
Tolerance, compromise, understanding, acceptance, patience - I want those all to be very sharp tools in my shed.

I have embraced crying mothers who have lost their children because our politicians put their personal agendas before the national good. I have no patience for injustice, no tolerance for government incompetence, no sympathy for leaders who fail their citizens.
Good character is not formed in a week or a month. It is created little by little, day by day. Protracted and patient effort is needed to develop good character.
When people see a legend, they call it a legend. But to be a legend, it's a lot of hard work and patience. You can't play for five or ten years and be a legend. It takes longer than that.
The more you know yourself, the more patience you have for what you see in others.
Patience has its limits. Take it too far, and it's cowardice.
A wise man is superior to any insults which can be put upon him, and the best reply to unseemly behavior is patience and moderation.
Our patience will achieve more than our force.
Amongst the qualities a hero should have, I would include determination, loyalty, courage, perseverance, patience, focus, intrepidity and selflessness.
It took me a while to learn the true meaning of patience and surrender, but I have finally accepted that healing doesn't happen on our schedule. It doesn't have a clock or a calendar.

People are stubborn about what they perceive to be the right thing or the wrong thing, and it takes a long time to filter this human condition. There's a waiting period until people catch up. But if you have patience - which it takes when someone thinks differently from you - everybody always catches up. That patience is a wonderful virtue.
Indeed, this life is a test. It is a test of many things - of our convictions and priorities, our faith and our faithfulness, our patience and our resilience, and in the end, our ultimate desires.
Have patience with all things, But, first of all with yourself.
The greatest power is often simple patience.
Patience and Diligence, like faith, remove mountains.
A garden is a grand teacher. It teaches patience and careful watchfulness; it teaches industry and thrift; above all it teaches entire trust.
To learn patience is not to rebel against every hardship.
A man who is a master of patience is master of everything else.
Allah is with people who show patience. If you are down in the dumps, Allah will help you if you have belief. But this is a personal thing between you and him. You can't fool Allah.
Patience and time do more than strength or passion.
Endurance is nobler than strength, and patience than beauty.
There is something good in all seeming failures. You are not to see that now. Time will reveal it. Be patient.
If you want to grow a beard like mine, the only thing I can tell you is that you have to have patience. You just have to let it grow.

He who rides the sea of the Nile must have sails woven of patience.

If you would know strength and patience, welcome the company of trees.
It is easier to find men who will volunteer to die, than to find those who are willing to endure pain with patience.

Come what may, all bad fortune is to be conquered by endurance.

You can't jump from little things to big things. It just takes time and patience.
Work hard. And have patience. Because no matter who you are, you're going to get hurt in your career and you have to be patient to get through the injuries.

No one can occupy your generosity except you. Who can occupy your patience when impatience roars through you? Who except you can choose not to act with judgment when all of your thoughts are judgmental? Your life is yours to live, no matter how you choose to live it. When you do not think about how you intend to live it, it lives you.

Just like his grandmother, he just keeps getting up and moving forward... with patience and wisdom, and courage and grace.

I always tell up-and-coming DJs you have to really love what you do and find that interest to drive you. It requires so much attention to detail, and it takes up a lot of your time. You hear a song, and there are so many little pieces that make that song work. It requires a lot of patience, diligence and resilience.

No, I will be the pattern of all patience; I will say nothing.

It is also used maliciously for a loud-mouthed, controlling woman who has no patience with deviating opinions.
